nodes.body:
### PR summary [2f69d40f6d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13656/commits/2f69d40f6d36cd62b5a33384fc0afd2d50fa2927)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The Zulip link in the description is broken.
Is it a good idea to do this if it is not working on windows yet? Maybe we can replace the `find` incantation with `scripts/mk_all.sh` until it gets fixed?

If I understand correctly, #13854 and #13850 will fix the script on Windows. (Help testing the second PR is welcome; I don't have a windows computer. Check out that branch, run `lake exe mk_all` and report if this works or not.)
Let's mark this PR as depending on them. (And I've added the zulip link - thanks for reminding me!)

bors d+

Sorry about causing the merge conflict you're about to have to resolve!

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

No worries - thanks for reviewing the dependent PR and this one. Since I just bors-ed the other PR, let me approve this one already.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9661735311/job/26650065255)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9661735311/job/26650065918)
